div.p: This paper is concerned with the stability of uncertain T-S fuzzy systems with interval time-varying delay. By uniformly dividing the delay interval into multiple segments and constructing an appropriate augmented Lyapunov-Krasovskii functional, some less conservative stability criteria are obtained, which include some existing results as special cases. Since a tighter bounding inequality is employed to deal with time-varying delay-dependent integral items, then some sources of computational complexity, such as the general convex combination and free weighting matrices are not necessary to be adopted in the derivation of our results. As a result, the developed criteria not only theoretically improve some existing results, but also have higher computational efficiency. Numerical examples are given to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.

div.head: Introduction
div.p: Over the past decades, much effort has been made in the stability analysis of T-S fuzzy systems with time delay, see for example [1][2][3][4][5][6][7][8] and references therein. Among the recent techniques adopted in this area, the delay-partitioning method [9] and the free weighting matrices method [10] should be mentioned. One divides the delay interval into multiple uniform segments [9,[11][12][13][14], it has been proved that less conservative results may be expected with the increasing delay-partitioning segments [15,16]; the latter introduces the free weighting matrices in the proof for revealing the inner relationship among the augment matrix inequalities or deleting the integral items [2,5,12]. In particular, to the system with time-varying delays, it is seen from [11,12] that the results based on convex combination technique [17] generally have the less conservativeness than those based on Jensen inequality [18], since none of any useful integral items are arbitrarily ignored in the proof.

Considering the interval time-varying delay, limited work has been reported in the open literature on delay-dependent stability analysis for T-S fuzzy systems. Among the limited work are Tian and Peng [19] on robust stability analysis, Lien and colleagues [6] who improved the work of Tian and Peng [19], and Jiang and Han [7] on robust H ∞ control. It is noted that all of the aforementioned works have employed the free weighting matrices in the derivation of their results, resulting in high computational demand especially when a large number of fuzzy rules are used [11]. More recently, by dividing the delay interval into two uniform segments, Peng et al. [11] and Tian et al. [12] obtained the less conservative results than those in [6,7,19], respectively. Jeeva Sathya et al. [13] obtained the improved results by extending the delay-decomposition method in [14,20] to T-S fuzzy systems. However, when revisiting this problem, we find that the results reported in [11][12][13] still leave plenty of room for improvement. For example,

• in [11,12], only delay bi-partitioning methods are introduced. If the delay interval is divided into multiple segments, and an appropriate Lyapunov functional is constructed, then the improved results may be expected; • in [11,13], the integral item -( 2 -1 )

Compared with those in [11,13], not only the number of LMI scalar decision variables but also the number of LMIs increases sharply with the increasing delay-partitioning segments.

This paper will develop a new delay-partitioning approach for robust stability analysis of uncertain T-S fuzzy systems with interval time-varying delay. By employing a tighter bounding technique [21] to deal with integral items and constructing an appropriate Lyapunov functional to include the multiple delay-partitioning characteristics, we obtain the improved stability conditions while depending on less number of LMIs and LMI scalar decision variables. Since (i) neither general convex combination nor free weighting matrices are employed; and (ii) none of any useful integral items are ignored in the derivation of our results, the aforementioned problems in [11][12][13] are effectively resolved. Furthermore, we not only theoretically prove that our results are less conservative than those in [11,13], but also show that our results have higher computational efficiency than those in [12] and some existing results in [11,13] are special cases of our results. div.head: Conclusion
div.p: The delay-partitioning method has been proposed for robust stability analysis of uncertain T-S fuzzy systems with time-varying interval delay. Simplified and improved delay-partitioning-dependent stability criteria have been established through using a new augmented Lyapunov-Krasovskii functional and a tighter integral inequality to deal with integral items in the proof. Because neither general convex combination nor free weighting matrices has been employed in the derivation of our stability criteria, the results obtained from this work are naturally less conservative and higher computationally efficient than those derived from some existing methods. We has theoretically proved that the results in [11,13] are special cases of our results. Numerical examples have been given to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.
